ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Walk me through a typical day in the past week from the time you woke up until you went to bed - how did you spend your time?
How often did you shower or bathe?
What are some goals that you have right now in your life? Write exact:
In the past week, how often did you work toward each these goals?
Did anyone encourage or push you to keep trying, or tell you to work on your goals?
You just told me about your goals. Why are these goals important to you?
How motivated are you to achieve your goals?
Did you come up with the idea for these goals or did someone else?
Did you spend a lot of time thinking about your goals?
How important is it to you to meet expectations and do a good job in these goal-related activities?
In the past week, did you wish you had more motivation to complete tasks?
What hobbies do you have right now?
In the past week, how often did you get to do each of these things and how much time did you spend doing each activity?
Did you have trouble starting or persisting in these activities (for example, starting to exercise and then immediately stopping)?
Did anyone have to prod you or tell you to make time for these activities?
How motivated were you to make time for your hobbies or recreation?
How important were these activities to you?
Did you come up with the idea for these hobbies or did someone else?
Did you spend a lot of time thinking about these hobbies?
How important is it to you to meet expectations and do a good job in these activities?
Did you wish you had more motivation to complete recreational activities?
Who did you spend time with (friends, family, romantic partner)?
How many days out of the week did you see each other?
How much time did you spend together? What did you do together? Are you close?
Did they contact you or did you contact them?
Did you talk to them about personal things (e.g., something you were excited or upset about)?
Did you have opportunities to interact with others? What got in the way?
Did you try to talk to someone in the past week in hopes of it leading to a relationship (romantic or otherwise)? [If Yes] How did you try to meet people?
Which relationships are most important to you and why?
Did you think about these people when you were not around them (e.g. wondering what they are doing, how they are, when you�ll see them again)?
When you were around people this past week, did you prefer to spend time with them or keep to yourself?
Did you ever feel lonely even though you were around other people?
Did you wish you were closer with anyone in your life (different friends, romantic partner)?
Did relationships feel important to you this past week? If so, which ones and why?
Did you think about these people when you were not around them (e.g. wondering what they are doing, how they are, when you�ll see them again)?
Did you wish you had more contact with other people?
Did you wish you were closer with anyone in your life or had other types of relationships (different friends, romantic partner)?
What websites or social media apps did you use this week?
Did you check social media/apps but not interact with others? [If Yes] How many days out of the week did this happen, and how much time did it take you per day?

Did you interact with others on a site/app (i.e., posting a comment on someone else's page, sending a private/instant message, liking someone's status or picture, or making your own status updates to communicate to others)? [If Yes] How many days out of the week did this happen, and how much time did it take you per day?
Were you interacting with people you are close with?
Did you discuss personal things with anyone via social media?
When others contact you on social media do you respond promptly?
Did you text or message anyone this week?
How many different people did you text or message in the week?
In the last week, how much time per day did you spend texting or messaging others?
Did you discuss personal things with anyone via text?
When on social media, how interested were you in the people you follow or are friends with?
Did you look forward to seeing posts or comments from your friends?
Are social media interactions important to you?
How much did you want to interact with others on social media?
Did you feel motivated to text others?
Did you look forward to checking your phone for text messages?
Did you prefer to text instead of talk to people on the phone or in person? [If Yes] Why is that?
[If Applicable] Why did you reach out to others?

Physical Intensity. In the last week, what made you feel good physically? What was the most intense physical enjoyment you had from any of those activities on a 1 (not at all) to 10 (extremely) scale?
Social Intensity. In the last week, which social interactions did you enjoy? What was the best you felt during any social activity in the past week on a 1 (not at all) to 10 (extremely) scale?

Recreational Intensity. In the last week, which recreational activities did you enjoy? What was the best you felt during any recreational activity in the past week on a 1 (not at all) to 10 (extremely) scale?

Work/School Intensity. In the last week, which work, school, or chore activities did you enjoy? What was the best you felt during any work, school, or chore activity in the past week on a 1 (not at all) to 10 (extremely) scale?
How many days out of the week did you engage in something physical and enjoy it?
How many days out of the week did you engage in something social and enjoy it?
How many days out of the week did you engage a recreational activity and enjoy it?
How many days out of the week did you engage in a work, school, or chore activity and enjoy it?
How good do you think you will feel the next time you do this type of activity on a 1 (not at all) to 10 (extremely) scale?
How many days in the past week were you distressed about your level of motivation, desire to interact with others, or ability to enjoy activities?
[If distress is present] How intense did this distress feel on a scale of 1 (not at all) to 10 (extreme/intolerable)?

Blunted facial affect refers to a reduction in the intensity and/or frequency of outward expression of emotion in the face. Ratings should be based on outward expression of emotion in response to questions asking about emotional experiences throughout earlier portions of the interview. If no emotional experience is reported during those sections of the interview, expression throughout the entire interview should be considered. Movements across the entire face should be considered when rating this item, including the eyes, forehead (e.g., raised brow), and mouth (e.g., smiling).

Vocal expression refers to the modulation of voice pitch. Greater modulation of pitch is expected while discussing emotional topics; reduced variation in pitch while discussing emotional topics is considered pathological. The amount of spoken words or content of speech is not considered in this item.

This item rates the frequency of nonverbal communicative gestures made throughout the interview. Particular attention should be paid to gestures made while discussing emotional topics, but gestures made throughout the entire interview are relevant. Multiple sources of nonverbal communication should be considered, including movements of the hands, head, shoulders, and trunk. Gestures not aimed at communication are not considered here (e.g., dyskinetic movements).

Alogia refers to the quantity of speech (i.e., number of words spoken) and amount of spontaneous elaboration (i.e., amount of information provided in addition to what is strictly necessary to answer a question). Speech abnormalities related to disorganization are not rated here (e.g., poverty of content of speech, pressure of speech, neologisms).
Asociality: Asociality Internal Experience
Notes: 0 = Absent; 1 = Questionable; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe; 5 = Extremely Severe; 9 = Cannot Be Scored; -900 = Missing; -300 = N/A

ElementDescription: Please click if this form is missing all of its data
Please specify the reason for missing data on this form
